### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — evening, warm interior lighting with city lights visible through windows.

Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - relaxed expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
The group is seated in Central Perk, engaged in a game involving papers and a pen. Monica and Phoebe are actively participating, with Monica holding a piece of paper and Phoebe writing on a pink sheet. Ross sits on the couch, reading a magazine, while Chandler sits nearby, also reading. Rachel is seated at the bar, looking at her phone. Joey is seated at a table, holding a drink. The group appears to be in a relaxed, social setting, with some members laughing and interacting.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on tables)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden table (with books and papers)
- Bar stools (with patrons seated)
- Menu board (behind counter)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
The group is singing theme songs from TV shows, indicating a lighthearted and playful atmosphere. The conversation is casual and humorous, with the characters enjoying each other's company. The tone is jovial, with everyone appearing to be in good spirits.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
None observed.

chunk_00002.subtitles: Aunt Silv, stop yelling. All I'm saying is, if you had told me vegetarian lasagna... ...I would've made vegetarian lasagna. Well, the meat's only every third layer.

The dialogue also includes a humorous aside about a friend named Tanya, which causes Ross to groan in exasper
chunk_00006.subtitles: Is it vegetarian? Because Susan doesn't eat meat. I'm pretty sure that it is. Yeah. So I got the results of the amnio today. Oh, tell me. Is everything? Don't you wanna know about the sex? The sex? Yeah, I'm having enough trouble with the image of you and Susan together. But when you throw in Tanya... [GROANS] The sex of the baby, Ross.

chunk_00007.subtitles: Oh. You know the sex of the baby? - Uh-huh. - Oh, oh, oh! - Do you want to know? - No, no, no. No, I don't want to know. Absolutely not. No, I think you shouldn't know until you look down there... ...and see, "Oh, there it is." Or isn't. - Oh. Hello, Ross. - Susan. So? So did you hear? Yes, we did. Everything's A-okay. Oh, that's so cool. CAROL: It really is. Ha, ha. Do we know? - We certainly do. It's going to be a... - Hey, hey! Ho, ho! Hello? See, a guy who doesn't wanna know standing right here. Oh. Ha, ha. Uh, well, is it what we thought it would be? - Mm-hm. - Aah! What? Okay, what did we think it' was gonna be? No, no, no. I don't want to know. Don't want to know. Okay.

chunk_00008.subtitles: I don't want to know. Don't want to know. Okay. You know, I should probably just go. - Well, thanks for the books. - No problem. Okay. Susan. All right, who should we call first? Your folks or Deb and Rhona? [DOOR BUZZER] Hello? ROSS [OVER INTERCOM]: Uh... Never mind. I don't wanna know. chunk_00009.subtitles: What do you mean, like, buy it together? Yeah. Do you think we're ready for something like that? - Why not? - Well, it's just a big commitment. I mean, what if one of us wants to move out? - Why, are you moving out? - I'm not moving out. You'd tell me if you were moving out, right? - Yes, it's just that, with my last roommate... - Oh, I know all about Kip. We bought a hibachi together, and then he ran off and got married... ...and things got pretty ugly. So let me ask you something. Was Kip a better roommate than me? Oh, don't do that. You've got a couple changes in your schedule. Your 4:00 herbal massage has been pushed back to 4:30. And Ms. Summerfield canceled her 5:30 shiatsu. Okay. Thanks. Oh. Here comes your 3:00. I don't mean to sound unprofessional, but, yum. [SPEAKING IN ITALIAN] Oh. Paolo. Hi. What are you doing here?

chunk_00010.subtitles: Oh. Paolo. Hi. What are you doing here? Uh, Rachella tell me you... ...massage? Yeah, well, Rachella's right. Yeah. [SPEAKING IN ITALIAN] Oh. Okay, I don't know what you just said, so let's just start. Uh, I am, uh... ...being naked? Um, that's really your decision. I mean, some people prefer, you know, to take off... Ooh, oops! Being naked. I can't believe you don't want to know. I mean, I could not know. I mean, if the doctor knows, and Carol knows, and Susan knows... And Monica knows. Heh. How could you? I don't even know. Carol called to thank me for the lasagna. I asked. She told me. So, what's it going to be? Whoa. Huh? Oh, great. Now he knows and I don't know. I'm sorry. I'm just excited about being an aunt.

chunk_00014.subtitles: Um, Rachel, can we talk for a sec? Well, sure. Just for a sec, though... ...because Paolo's on his way over. - Oh. Okay. Um... Okay. Um... - Oh, Pheebs... - Um, okay. Um, ahem. We haven't known each other for that long a time. And, um, there are three things that you should know about me. One, my friends are the most important thing in my life. Two, I never lie. And three, I make the best oatmeal-raisin cookies in the world. Okay. Thanks, Pheebs. Mm, my God. Why have I never tasted these before? Oh, I don't make them a lot... ...because I don't think it's fair to the other cookies. Ahem, God.

chunk_00015.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm ambient lighting with lamps and decorative wall art visible.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**

Phoebe Buffay: dark purple sweater - unclear lower clothing - long blonde hair in a ponytail - expression animated and engaged
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - jeans - dark hair tied back - expression serious and focused
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt - dark pants - short brown hair - expression smirking
Ross Geller: dark sweater - jeans - short dark hair - expression serious, then amused
Joey Tribbiani: white shirt - dark pants - medium-length brown hair - expression smiling

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel and Phoebe sit on the couch, engaged in conversation, with Rachel gesturing while speaking and Phoebe responding. Monica stands near the foosball table, interacting with Ross and Chandler, who are playing foosball. Joey enters the scene and joins the group. Rachel drinks from a red thermos while Phoebe unpacks items from a suitcase on the coffee table.

- Red thermos: (held by Rachel)
- Suitcase: open, on coffee table (with clothes inside)

- Picture frame: on side table
- Blue handbag: on couch

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses a topic with Phoebe, who responds while gesturing. The conversation has a casual tone
chunk_00015.subtitles: Ahem, God. Well, you're right. These are the best oatmeal-raisin cookies I've ever had. - Which proves that I never lie. - I guess you don't. Paolo made a pass at me. So, what do you think? I think it's the most beautiful table I've ever seen. I know. So how does this work? Gonna balance the plates on these little heads? Who cares? We'll eat at the sink. Come on. Heads up, Ross. Score! You suck. Are you okay? I need some milk. I've got milk. Here you go.

chunk_00016.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
The living room of Monica and Rachel's apartment — evening, warm ambient lighting from lamps and a visible candle.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored patterned dress - unclear lower clothing - long, wavy brown hair tied back with a hair clip - expression shifts from animated to concerned
Phoebe Buffay: dark-colored sweater over a dark top - long, blonde hair in a half-up style with a hair clip - expression animated and concerned

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel sits on the couch, initially drinking from a red cup, then stands and walks to the kitchen area, retrieving a white cloth. She returns to the living room and gestures while speaking to Phoebe, who is seated on the couch. Phoebe reacts with animated gestures and expressions, appearing concerned and surprised as the conversation unfolds. Rachel holds the white cloth and appears to be explaining something, while Phoebe responds with visible emotion.

- White cloth: (held by Rachel)

- Refrigerator: (visible in kitchen area)
- Blue cabinets: (in kitchen background)
- Red and white quilted pillow: (on couch)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
chunk_00016.subtitles: Better? No. Ugh! I feel so stupid. I think about the other day, with you guys, you know. And I was all, "Oh, Paolo. He's so great. He makes me feel so..." Ugh! God. I'm so embarrassed. I'm the one he hit on. I unleashed him on you. If I'd never met him... ...this would've never happened. - I'm so sorry. - No, I'm sorry. BOTH: No, I'm sorry. Oh, wait. Oh. - What are we sorry about? - I don't know. Right. He's the pig. - Such a pig. - Oh, God, he's such a pig. - Oh, he's like a big disgusting pig... - Yeah, like a... - Pig man. - Yes, good. Okay. Oh, but he was my pig man. How did I not see this?

chunk_00017.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
The apartment living room and kitchen area — evening, warm ambient lighting from lamps and overhead fixtures.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light-colored patterned shirt - unclear lower clothing - brown, shoulder-length hair with clips - concerned expression
Phoebe Buffay: dark-colored long sweater - unclear lower clothing - blonde, long, loose hair - animated expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel sits at a wooden table, looking down at a piece of paper and appearing distressed. Phoebe approaches, places a comforting hand on Rachel's shoulder, and then embraces her. Later, the scene shifts to a foosball table where Phoebe and others are playing, with Phoebe standing near the table and talking animatedly.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Wooden table (center of frame)
- Foosball table (with red and blue figures)
- Refrigerator (with magnets and notes)
- Blue kitchen cabinets
- Lamp (on side table)
- Various kitchen items (on shelves)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Phoebe discusses a romantic situation with Rachel, mentioning a man who is "gorgeous and charming." The conversation has a casual, slightly teasing tone, with Phoebe appearing animated and Rachel reacting with concern. Phoebe reassures Rachel that it's better she knows, and they both seem to be processing the situation.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel moves from standing to sitting at the table.
Phoebe moves from standing behind Rachel to embracing her.
The scene transitions to the foosball table with Phoebe standing near it.
chunk_00017.subtitles: Oh, I know! Because... ...he's gorgeous. And he's charming. - And when he looks at you... - Okay. Okay, Pheebs. The end. Ugh. God. Should I not have told you? No, trust me, it's much better that I know. Uh, I just liked it better before. It was better. I think she took it pretty well. You know, Paolo's over there right now, so... Yeah, we should get over there and see if she's okay. Just one second. - Whoo! Score. - Game. Us.

chunk_00018.subtitles: - Whoo! Score. - Game. Us. Yes. Come on, Pheebs. Whoo. Well, it looks like, uh, we kicked your butts. No, no. She kicked our butts. You could be on the Olympic "Standing There" team. Come on. Two on one. What are you still doing here? She just broke up with the guy. It's time for you to swoop in. What? Now? Yes. Now is when you swoop. You gotta make sure that when Paolo walks out... ...the first guy Rachel sees is you. She's got to know that you're everything he's not. You're like... Like the anti-Paolo. My Catholic friend is right. She's distraught. You're there for her. You pick up the pieces, and then you usher in: The Age of Ross. [PAOLO SPEAKING IN ITALIAN] RACHEL: See this? See? chunk_00019.subtitles: - How's it going? MONICA: Don't stare. She just finished throwing his clothes off the balcony. Now there's just a lot of gesturing and arm-waving. Okay, that is either, "How could you?" Or "Enormous breasts." Here he comes. Uh, I am, uh... ...to say goodbye. Oh, okay, bye-bye. Paolo. I really hate you for what you did to Rachel. chunk_00020.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
The exterior of an apartment building at night, with dim lighting from a nearby lamp and window. The scene transitions to a dimly lit alleyway with brick walls.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: dark-colored jacket - light-colored top - long, blonde hair - serious expression
Ross Geller: dark-colored sweater - blue jeans - dark, short hair - concerned expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller enters the apartment and walks toward Rachel Green, who is standing near a window. They engage in a conversation, with Ross gesturing as he speaks. Rachel listens intently, then turns to face Ross, and they share a moment of emotional connection, culminating in a hug. After the hug, they continue talking, with Rachel appearing thoughtful and Ross looking earnest.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Brick wall (background)
- Window with metal bars
- Concrete ledge (where characters stand)
- Lamp (providing dim lighting)
- Door (visible in background)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses Ross's relationship with Rachel Green, advising her to be with someone who appreciates her. The conversation has a serious and supportive tone, with Ross appearing concerned and Rachel reacting with a thoughtful expression.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel Green moves from standing near the window to facing Ross.
Ross Geller enters the apartment and walks toward Rachel Green.
Ross Geller and Rachel Green share a hug.
Ross Geller and Rachel Green continue talking after the hug.
chunk_00020.subtitles: PHOEBE: Oh. Just look at her. Oh, you guys, I really think only one of us should go out there... ...so she's not overwhelmed. - Oh, right. And I really think it should be me. BOTH: Hey. You all right? Oh. I've been better. [SIGHS] Come here. Listen... ...you deserve so much better than him. You know? I mean, you... You should be with a guy who knows what he has when he has you. Ross... What? I'm so sick of guys.
chunk_00020.episode: 1x12 - The One with the Dozen Lasagnas

chunk_00021.subtitles: I'm so sick of guys. I don't want to look at another guy. I don't want to think about another guy. I don't even want to be near another guy. [RACHEL SIGHS] Huh. - Ross, you're so great. - Oh, ha, ha. MONICA: Are you all right? PHOEBE: Are you okay? Medium. Heh. - Any cookies left? - Yeah. Heh. See, Rach, um... See, I don't think swearing off guys altogether is the answer. I really don't. I think what you need is to develop a more sophisticated screening process.
